DOC.brief_summary: Background To evaluate efficacy two alcohol-free antimicrobial mouthrinses reduce plaque gingivitis compare alcohol-containing rinse toothbrushing alone . Methods 160 healthy volunteer enrol parallel-design examiner-blind study . After screen stratification sex papillary bleeding index ( PBI ) , participant randomly equally assign four group : ( 1 ) toothbrushing + rinsing ( 0.06 % CHX + 0.025 % NaF , alcohol-containing rinse , CorsodylÂ® Daily Defence Mouthwash ; positive control ) ; ( 2 ) toothbrushing + rinsing ( 0.06 % CHX + 0.025 % NaF , alcohol-free experimental rinse ) ; ( 3 ) toothbrushing + rinsing ( 0.06 % CHX + 0.03 % CPC + 0.025 % NaF , alcohol-free experimental rinse ) ; ( 4 ) toothbrushing alone ( negative control ) . At baseline , Quigley-Hein plaque index ( QHI ) , modify proximal plaque index ( MPPI ) , PBI record . All subject advise brush teeth usual eight week study period . Additionally , group 1-3 instructed rinse twice daily ( 30 sec . ) . All participant use Dr. Best multi aktiv toothpaste Dr. Best plus toothbrush ( medium stiffness ) . Eight week baseline , index record . Anova Bonferroni adjustment use statistical analysis .
